author: codeperfect.
content: Do I need to hold a token or something?

author: muddlebee
content: afaik anyone can participate. just that you won't get paid as for that the applications has been closed.

author: steegecs
content: Is it too late to join the second cohort? I understand it wouldn't be paid, but would the same kind of support be offered?

author: steegecs
content: Or! Will there be a third cohort in the near future?

author: muddlebee
content:
<@!498674844272164865>  as per <@!364458974906548225> 

> Some people will choose to participate independent of funding, either because they don't need it, or simply because they are interested and able.

More : https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/843176491386667018/890375144890073169

It's open and free for all. OSS?
Github repo : https://github.com/ethereum-cdap/cohort-one/

Program details : https://github.com/ethereum-cdap/cohort-one/blob/master/program-details.md/
> Other candidates who choose to participate independent of funding may be extended the option of receiving funding as the program progresses.

You can check sample notes and progress of folks here : https://github.com/ethereum-cdap/cohort-one/tree/master/notes/sevki/

It's high time to catch up with the folks here. from my observation Cohort two is just getting started and they have these weekly calls on Thursday.

author: muddlebee
content: btw I am planning to participate independently as well. My stage 1 notes are still WIP ðŸ‘€  Looking forward to learn from the folks here ðŸš€

author: muddlebee
content: https://github.com/ethereum-cdap/cohort-zero Cohort Zero notes will give some of the idea regarding Identifying Potential Projects and getting some idea on what was done earlier

author: steegecs
content: Great - Thank you for the response with resources and all, muddlebee!
